correct: Interpretation Task 2.3: You need to discuss model diagnosis. Under model diagnosis, you must discuss whether and how the key assumptions of linear regression are met. question: Task 5 • Time series plot – Interpretation in terms of 4 components
correct: Task 5:
incorrect: Task 5 : You should clearly explain why the Multiplicative Forecasting Model should be used for prediction. Since the line plot shows the presence of the seasonal component, therefore, a multiplicative time series should be used. Explain clearly why 12 Period Moving Average (not 4) is used instead of other smoothing methods. You should also explain why normalising indices was necessary (i.e., since the sum of averages did not add up to 12, we need to normalise the seasonal indices). Finally, you should evaluate the forecasting model using MAPE (i.e. average absolute predictive error one may commit when using the forecast model for predicting future Turn Over values).

question: Task 5 Use of 12-MA period – Justifications

Report Structure

Introduction: The introduction begins by highlighting the main purpose(s) of analysis and concludes by explaining the structure of the report (i.e., subsequent sections).

In conclusion, along with the key findings of analyses you should explain the main limitations.

The report would require few editing in order to be classified as professional. You are expected to attach all necessary analysis outputs in appendix.
